results.title: On the border of life: glimpses of French biological research
results.creator_credit: Triangle Productions, Jacqueline Jacoupy, Nicole Vedres and Jean Rostand
results.brief_description: Opens with brief introductions to biology, and then surveys the work of leading French laboratories. The ground covered includes experiments in artificial parthenogenesis, sex determination, suspended animation and research into the secrets of immortality. Commentary by John Barry.

results.title: On the Black Hill
results.creator_credit: Jennifer Howarth, BFI and Andrew Grieve
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Bruce Chatwin, this is an unrelenting portrayal of the raw experience of rural farm life in the Welsh border country. Starting in 1895, it focuses on the lives of four generations of a farming community and spans 85 years. At the heart of the story is the intense relationship between identical twin brothers, Benjamin (Mike Gwilym) and Lewis (Robert Gwilym) Jones. The film ultimately expresses the healing nature of time and the promise of the future.

results.title: On the Birdsville Track
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Jack Absalom’s outback Australia series”.
The most infamous bush track runs for 540 kilometres through Australia’s centre. Its history is one of personal hardships and tough pioneering people. Once goods were carried to remote cattle properties by camel and only in recent times was a road made across the sand dunes. Jack Absalom recalls the old times, meets newcomers to “The Birdsville Track” and has some sound travel advice. Rated: G

results.title: On target marketing: retailing and services; manufacturing
results.creator_credit: Tony Coyte, Film Australia and Paul Humfress
results.brief_description: Marketing techniques are described and illustrated through a sequence of case studies which show how successful small business owners developed a marketing strategy which contributed to the growth and increased profitability of their businesses. This program takes examples of small businesses from the manufacturing, retail and service sectors.

results.title: On such a night
results.brief_description: A visit to Glyndebourne opera by a young American. Intrigued by a group of people in evening dress at Victoria Station, he follows them to Glyndebourne and learns of this centre of opera in an historic country house. Shows excerpts from a performance of Mozart’s The Marriage of Figaro with the Royal Philharmonic Orchestra.

results.title: On stream
results.creator_credit: John Heyer and Shell Company of Australia
results.brief_description: Records the building of the Shell Oil Refinery at Geelong, Victoria. Shows initial stages in the cleaning, dredging and excavating of the land; the arrival of a Dutch contracting firm for the building of the one million pound distillation plant; laying of the pipeline which will carry petroleum to Melbourne. Narrated by Mungo MacCallum.

results.title: On stage please at Hackney Empire
results.creator_credit: David E Naughton Film and Television Productions, David L. Watkins and David E. Naughton
results.brief_description: An historical account of one of Britain’s last-standing music hall theatres, the Hackney Empire. Opened in 1901 this wonderful theatre became the home for many famous British music hall artists and entertainers right up into the 1950s when it was finally closed down in 1956. However, against all odds, the music theatre has survived and this film documents the re-opening in 1989 with interviews, personal reminiscings, stills, archival footage and live performances from past and present entertainers including Bernard Bresslaw, Roy Hudd, Chas ‘n’ Dave, Helen shapiro, Frankie Vaughan, Tommy Trinder, Barbara Windsor, Larry Adler and many more. Also features the Royal Artillery Orchestra. Variety at its best.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David E Naughton Film and Television Productions, David L. Watkins and David E. Naughton

results.title: On stage
results.creator_credit: Tom Daly, ONF | NFB and Ronald Dick
results.brief_description: Follows a community group in the production of a play from initial casting auditions to the final actual performance. Attempts to give, through its explanatory commentary, an overall view of typical amateur activities and a few hints on common theatrical and organisational problems.

results.title: On solder
results.brief_description: Presents the latest soldering techniques used in the electronics industry. Uses close-up photography to reveal the physical and chemical actions that occur in soldering. Shows the difference between perfect and imperfect solder points and demonstrates the detrimental effect of a poor joint on the efficiency of the electronic circuit.
